body:
During an e2e test run, on GCE, I ssh-ed into the box.  After the reboot test runs, it appears that something is trying to start kubelet every 2 minutes after the reboot:

```
root@e2e-test-justinsb-minion-2f1v:/var/log# grep 10255.*address.already.in.use kubelet.log 
F0524 03:05:14.152932    3046 server.go:94] listen tcp 0.0.0.0:10255: bind: address already in use
F0524 03:07:14.405887    5834 server.go:94] listen tcp 0.0.0.0:10255: bind: address already in use
F0524 03:09:13.244865    8894 server.go:94] listen tcp 0.0.0.0:10255: bind: address already in use
F0524 03:11:13.442021   11680 server.go:94] listen tcp 0.0.0.0:10255: bind: address already in use
F0524 03:13:13.400658   14517 server.go:94] listen tcp 0.0.0.0:10255: bind: address already in use
F0524 03:15:13.970370   17560 server.go:94] listen tcp 0.0.0.0:10255: bind: address already in use
F0524 03:17:13.591999   20434 server.go:94] listen tcp 0.0.0.0:10255: bind: address already in use
F0524 03:19:13.263692   23231 server.go:94] listen tcp 0.0.0.0:10255: bind: address already in use
F0524 03:21:13.156136   26051 server.go:94] listen tcp 0.0.0.0:10255: bind: address already in use
F0524 03:23:13.357155   28880 server.go:94] listen tcp 0.0.0.0:10255: bind: address already in use
F0524 03:25:15.517584   31690 server.go:94] listen tcp 0.0.0.0:10255: bind: address already in use
F0524 03:27:14.185708    2086 server.go:94] listen tcp 0.0.0.0:10255: bind: address already in use
F0524 03:29:13.620250    5083 server.go:94] listen tcp 0.0.0.0:10255: bind: address already in use
F0524 03:31:13.569076    8059 server.go:94] listen tcp 0.0.0.0:10255: bind: address already in use
F0524 03:33:16.153124   10865 server.go:94] listen tcp 0.0.0.0:10255: bind: address already in use
F0524 03:35:13.670778   13669 server.go:94] listen tcp 0.0.0.0:10255: bind: address already in use
```

It does appear that it is monit restarting the process:

```
root@e2e-test-justinsb-minion-2f1v:/var/log# less monit.log
...
[UTC May 24 03:04:28] info     : monit daemon with pid [3189] killed
[UTC May 24 03:04:28] info     : 'system_e2e-test-justinsb-minion-2f1v.c.kubernetes-e2e-justinsb.internal' Monit stopped
[UTC May 24 03:05:00] info     : Starting monit daemon
[UTC May 24 03:05:00] info     : 'system_e2e-test-justinsb-minion-2f1v.c.kubernetes-e2e-justinsb.internal' Monit started
[UTC May 24 03:05:00] error    : 'kubelet' failed, cannot open a connection to INET[127.0.0.1:10248/healthz] via TCP
[UTC May 24 03:05:00] info     : 'kubelet' trying to restart
[UTC May 24 03:05:00] info     : 'kubelet' stop: /etc/init.d/kubelet
[UTC May 24 03:05:00] info     : 'kubelet' start: /etc/init.d/kubelet
[UTC May 24 03:07:12] error    : 'kubelet' process is not running
[UTC May 24 03:07:12] info     : 'kubelet' trying to restart
[UTC May 24 03:07:12] info     : 'kubelet' start: /etc/init.d/kubelet
[UTC May 24 03:07:12] error    : 'docker' process PID changed from 3010 to 3430
[UTC May 24 03:09:12] error    : 'kubelet' process is not running
[UTC May 24 03:09:12] info     : 'kubelet' trying to restart
[UTC May 24 03:09:12] info     : 'kubelet' start: /etc/init.d/kubelet
[UTC May 24 03:09:12] info     : 'docker' process PID has not changed since last cycle
[UTC May 24 03:11:12] error    : 'kubelet' process is not running
[UTC May 24 03:11:12] info     : 'kubelet' trying to restart
[UTC May 24 03:11:12] info     : 'kubelet' start: /etc/init.d/kubelet
[UTC May 24 03:13:12] error    : 'kubelet' process is not running
```

I do only have one copy of kubelet running, because the second kubelet fails to start:

```
I0524 03:33:13.243294   10865 manager.go:123] cAdvisor running in container: "/"
I0524 03:33:13.244165   10865 fs.go:88] Filesystem partitions: map[/dev/disk/by-uuid/6cc2497e-4350-495e-bf91-c9488eb20b9f:{mountpoint:/ major:8 minor:1}]
I0524 03:33:13.246309   10865 machine.go:224] Couldn't collect info from any of the files in "/etc/machine-id,/var/lib/dbus/machine-id"
I0524 03:33:13.246359   10865 manager.go:144] Machine: {NumCores:4 CpuFrequency:2299944 MemoryCapacity:15807709184 MachineID: SystemUUID:86BF40AB-55D3-14E3-C7D5-188ACE0E2580 BootID:d17900fb-f4c4-49f6-9499-6bd8148f
2c77 Filesystems:[{Device:/dev/disk/by-uuid/6cc2497e-4350-495e-bf91-c9488eb20b9f Capacity:105553100800}] DiskMap:map[8:0:{Name:sda Major:8 Minor:0 Size:107374182400 Scheduler:cfq}] NetworkDevices:[{Name:cbr0 MacAd
dress:12:72:3b:d3:2f:c1 Speed:0 Mtu:1460} {Name:eth0 MacAddress:42:01:0a:f0:af:5a Speed:0 Mtu:1460}] Topology:[{Id:0 Memory:15807709184 Cores:[{Id:0 Threads:[0 1] Caches:[{Size:32768 Type:Data Level:1} {Size:32768
 Type:Instruction Level:1} {Size:262144 Type:Unified Level:2}]} {Id:1 Threads:[2 3] Caches:[{Size:32768 Type:Data Level:1} {Size:32768 Type:Instruction Level:1} {Size:262144 Type:Unified Level:2}]}] Caches:[{Size:
47185920 Type:Unified Level:3}]}]}
I0524 03:33:13.247076   10865 manager.go:151] Version: {KernelVersion:3.16.0-0.bpo.4-amd64 ContainerOsVersion:Debian GNU/Linux 7 (wheezy) DockerVersion:1.6.0 CadvisorVersion:0.13.0}
I0524 03:33:13.247520   10865 cadvisor_linux.go:99] Failed to register cAdvisor on port 4194, retrying. Error: listen tcp :4194: bind: address already in use
I0524 03:33:13.249906   10865 server.go:275] Successfully initialized cloud provider: "gce" from the config file: ""
I0524 03:33:16.092695   10865 docker.go:271] Connecting to docker on unix:///var/run/docker.sock
I0524 03:33:16.093843   10865 server.go:587] Adding manifest file: /etc/kubernetes/manifests
I0524 03:33:16.093896   10865 file.go:47] Watching path "/etc/kubernetes/manifests"
I0524 03:33:16.093911   10865 server.go:597] Watching apiserver
I0524 03:33:16.120944   10865 manager.go:149] Setting dockerRoot to /var/lib/docker
I0524 03:33:16.130387   10865 plugins.go:56] Registering credential provider: .dockercfg
I0524 03:33:16.137667   10865 plugins.go:56] Registering credential provider: google-dockercfg
I0524 03:33:16.148817   10865 plugins.go:56] Registering credential provider: google-dockercfg-url
I0524 03:33:16.149487   10865 plugins.go:56] Registering credential provider: google-container-registry
I0524 03:33:16.150304   10865 plugins.go:171] Loaded volume plugin "kubernetes.io/aws-ebs"
I0524 03:33:16.150341   10865 plugins.go:171] Loaded volume plugin "kubernetes.io/empty-dir"
I0524 03:33:16.150357   10865 plugins.go:171] Loaded volume plugin "empty"
I0524 03:33:16.150377   10865 plugins.go:171] Loaded volume plugin "kubernetes.io/gce-pd"
I0524 03:33:16.150390   10865 plugins.go:171] Loaded volume plugin "gce-pd"
I0524 03:33:16.150409   10865 plugins.go:171] Loaded volume plugin "kubernetes.io/git-repo"
I0524 03:33:16.150421   10865 plugins.go:171] Loaded volume plugin "git"

I0524 03:33:16.150461   10865 plugins.go:171] Loaded volume plugin "kubernetes.io/nfs"
I0524 03:33:16.150482   10865 plugins.go:171] Loaded volume plugin "kubernetes.io/secret"

I0524 03:33:16.150570   10865 plugins.go:171] Loaded volume plugin "kubernetes.io/rbd"
I0524 03:33:16.150600   10865 server.go:559] Started kubelet
I0524 03:33:16.150769   10865 server.go:81] Starting to listen read-only on 0.0.0.0:10255
E0524 03:33:16.150792   10865 kubelet.go:638] Image garbage collection failed: unable to find data for container /
E0524 03:33:16.150857   10865 server.go:363] Starting health server failed: listen tcp 127.0.0.1:10248: bind: address already in use
I0524 03:33:16.150881   10865 event.go:203] Event(api.ObjectReference{Kind:"Node", Namespace:"", Name:"e2e-test-justinsb-minion-2f1v", UID:"e2e-test-justinsb-minion-2f1v", APIVersion:"", ResourceVersion:"", FieldPath:""}): reason: 'starting' Starting kubelet.
I0524 03:33:16.152624   10865 server.go:62] Starting to listen on 0.0.0.0:10250
F0524 03:33:16.153124   10865 server.go:94] listen tcp 0.0.0.0:10255: bind: address already in use
```

labels.description: Must be staffed and worked on either currently, or very soon, ideally in time for the next release.
labels.name: priority/important-soon

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Node.
labels.name: sig/node

milestone.description: Issues that need to be resolved for v1.0 of Kubernetes.
milestone.title: v1.0

title: monit tries to run second instance of kubelet every 2 minutes after reboot (?)
